title: Coming and Going
name: Coming and Going
description:
A Map by Blogonthehill

Which shops or stores are departing Chestnut Hill, and which ones are arriving.

properties.name: 7908-10 Germantown Ave.
properties.description: Posted by Blogonthehill7908 Germantown Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19118This one has been vacant since Summer 2001, according to the Chestnut Hill Local.

properties.name: 8001 Germantown Ave.
properties.description: Posted by Blogonthehill8001 Germantown Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19118This one is at Germantown and Willow Grove avenues. The building reportedly dates back to 1926. Its original use was as Foster\'s Drugstore and Soda Fountain. Back in 2005, it was to have become the home of Shundeez Persian restaurant. The deal fell through. Now, Shundeez is at the top of the Hill, in a space formerly occupied by Roller\'s restaurant.

properties.name: 8428 Germantown Ave.
properties.description: Posted by Blogonthehill8428 Germantown Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19118Most recently home to Hideaway Music (now up the Hill at 8612 Germantown Ave.) and formerly occupied by Russell Medinger\'s flower shop, this lovely old building near Caruso\'s Market has been vacant since September 2006.

properties.name: Blue Moon
properties.description: Posted by Blogonthehill8044 Germantown Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19118It was once one of the mainstays of Chestnut Hill, a cool little neighborhood restaurant in SOHA (south of Hartwell Lane). The building looks to have been substantially rehabbed--a beautiful job. Still, it has been vacant for about 10 years.

properties.name: Cake
properties.description: Posted by Blogonthehill8501 Germantown Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19118The cute little neighborhood bakery known as Cake is moving from its cozy nook on Evergreen Avenue, behind the Wachovia Bank, into the beautiful atrium behind Robertson\'s. Hard to see this as anything but a win-win for Robertson\'s and Cake. Owner Grey Heck hopes for a late June, 2007, opening.

properties.name: Chico's
properties.description: Posted by Blogonthehill8532 Germantown Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19118The posh women\'s clothing shop is departing Germantown Avenue for the Plymouth Meeting Mall, according to the Chestnut Hill Local.

properties.name: Citibank
properties.description: Posted by Blogonthehill8500 Germantown Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19118The bank -- yes, another bank -- is opening a branch at the corner of Germantown Avenue and West Highland Avenue, breaking through the wall between 8500 and 8504 Germantown Ave., formerly a cell phone outlet.

properties.name: Color Me Mine
properties.description: Posted by Blogonthehill8524 Germantown Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19118After a decade at 8524 Germantown Ave., Color Me Mine is leaving the Hill. Owners told the Chestnut Hill Local that the decision to move to Elkins Park was influenced by "empty store fronts" along the Avenue--including the closing of Wawa, just around the corner, and the impending closure of Chico\'s, just up the street.

properties.name: Commerce Bank
properties.description: Posted by Blogonthehill8600 Germantown Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19118This is the Commerce Bank, one of the many banks lining Germantown Avenue. On the one hand, it\'s bright. Damn bright. A lot of people don\'t like that, but it\'s hard for me to see bright light along the Avenue at night as anything but a good thing. And at least this building does not look nearly as nightmarish as Commerce Bank\'s many other outlets that draw heavily on the "funhaus" school of art and architecture. Still, with the huge windows and the oversized, tacky graphics, this building seems determined not to blend in. Not the worst thing that could have happened, but surely not the best.

properties.name: Evangeline
properties.description: Posted by Blogonthehill8517 Germantown Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19118Opened in May 2007 in a shop formerly occupied by Talbot\'s Petites.

properties.name: Wawa
properties.description: Posted by Blogonthehill23 W. Highland Ave., Philadelphia, PA 19118This is the cold carcass of the late, lamented Chestnut Hill Wawa. It\'s going to be yet another bank.
